\

\LoggerLayoutHtml

This layout outputs events in a HTML table.

Configurable parameters for this layout are:

  • title
  • locationInfo

An example for this layout:

** File not found : ../../examples/php/layout_html.php **

The corresponding XML file:

** File not found : ../../examples/resources/layout_html.properties **

The above will print a HTML table that looks, converted back to plain text, like the following:

   Log session start time Wed Sep 9 00:11:30 2009

   Time Thread Level Category   Message
   0    8318   INFO  root       Hello World!

File
core/log4php/layouts/LoggerLayoutHtml.php
Package
log4php\layouts
Class hierarchy
\LoggerConfigurable
\LoggerLayout
\LoggerLayoutHtml

Tags

version

$Revision: 1379731 $

Properties

$locationInfo

$locationInfo : boolean

The <b>LocationInfo</b> option takes a boolean value. By default, it is set to false which means there will be no location information output by this layout. If the the option is set to true, then the file name and line number of the statement at the origin of the log statement will be output.

If you are embedding this layout within a [LoggerAppenderMail](../classes/LoggerAppenderMail.html) or a [LoggerAppenderMailEvent](../classes/LoggerAppenderMailEvent.html) then make sure to set the LocationInfo option of that appender as well.

Type

boolean

Tags

None found

$title

$title : string

The <b>Title</b> option takes a String value. This option sets the document title of the generated HTML document.

Defaults to 'Log4php Log Messages'.

Type

string

Tags

None found

Override this method if you have options to be activated.

setLocationInfo()

setLocationInfo(  $flag)

The <b>LocationInfo</b> option takes a boolean value. By default, it is set to false which means there will be no location information output by this layout. If the the option is set to true, then the file name and line number of the statement at the origin of the log statement will be output.

If you are embedding this layout within a [LoggerAppenderMail](../classes/LoggerAppenderMail.html) or a [LoggerAppenderMailEvent](../classes/LoggerAppenderMailEvent.html) then make sure to set the LocationInfo option of that appender as well.

Parameters

$flag

Inherited from
